attributes.action: Change the high income child benefit tax to household income and not sole income
attributes.additional_details: I feel that the way this is calculated is unfair.  I have written to my local MP and have received a reply from the treasury saying that to change the way this tax is calculated it will become means tested and will cost more money.  I feel that it is appalling that if you are in a partnership and one person within the household earns greater than £50k that person is required to complete a self assessment and repay some child benefit.  2 people can earn £49999 each and not repay anything
attributes.background: I want the government to change the way in which the high income child benefit is calculated.  Currently it is based on either member of the household earning greater than £50k.  Where as 2 family members can earn £49999.00 without the need for a self assessment tax return and no child benefit tax

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300149
